column4: I'm suspicious of that message tbh. Ubuntu includes FF3.0 with security patches.
in fact I'm sure. The ubuntu Hardy FF, assuming you have applied automatic updates from apt, is the latest
if you go to Help -> About in FF it tells you the version at the bottom
That is exactly what I thought and its why I don't understand whats happening
I think hotmail is reading the useragent incorrectly or something
or else perhaps it hasn't been taught that 3.0.2 is the latest version
I just don't know. I'd like to find a solution with a bit of help
well as it's definitely up-to-date in ubuntu I would suggest that you have to ask MS/an MS forum for help; Ubuntu/FF is not at fault as far as I can see
dr_willis: Can I try updating on terminal??
nothing's wrong with your FF. I'm sure mine is working fine and I still see the message.
updating won't make any difference. you already have the latest version.
though for the record, "sudo apt-get update firefox" will do the update if a newer version is available
basically the hotmail devs haven't reacted fast enough to the latest FF update
Thats fine, but I cant access my hotmail account
hrm. Odd. I can access mine albeit with the old interface. However, mine is a very old account.
did you click "continue to Windows Live hotmail"?
No i clicked on the Linux option not windows
hrm, hang on
it says "download new browsers blah blah..." and then at the bottom there's a link to "continue to Windows Live hotmail"
Eureka you have hit the nail on the head. A million thanks to you!!!!
np :)
